subject: Nutrition
title: The Food Pyramid Story
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Food Pyramid Story.

hook.text: The 1992 Food Pyramid told Americans to eat 6 to 11 servings of bread daily. Obesity followed.

buildup.text: Nutritionists originally put fruits and vegetables at the base, with grains secondary.

discovery.text: The grain industry lobbied the USDA to swap positionsâ€”putting grains at the base instead.

twist.text: The resulting pyramid promoted a carb-heavy diet during the same decades that obesity tripled.

climax.text: In 2011, the USDA replaced the pyramid with MyPlateâ€”quietly admitting the old model was misleading.

punchline.text: Industry lobbyists designed America's diet guide.

quiz.question: Why were grains placed at the pyramid's base?
